snippet: A meeting that started with discussions about the federal health care site shifted quickly to the concerns over National Security Agency spying.
abstract: Meeting between Pres Obama and technology industry executives that started with discussions about the federal health care site shifts quickly to the concerns of Apple, Microsoft, Google and other companies over National Security Agency spying; Obama and executives find a shared fading of public trust.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and NICK WINGFIELD
byline.contributor: Jackie Calmes reported from Washington and Nick Wingfield from Seattle. Claire Cain Miller and Nicole Perlroth contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: A meeting that started with discussions about the federal health care site shifted quickly to the concerns over National Security Agency spying.

headline.main: Tech Leaders and Obama Find Shared Problem: Fading Public Trust
headline.print_headline: Tech Leaders and Obama Find Shared Problem: Fading Public Trust
